message.content:
{"id": "17993", "title": "Bug 17993: Find/Replace shouldn't replace typed entry with value from history", "description": "It would be better if what I type isn't replaced with a value from the history. The current behavior seems to be similar to \"autocomplete\" which is particularly common in browsers. In the future, perhaps, a full \"autocomplete\" feature could be provided.", 
"OB": "When performing find and replace operations, the current behavior is to replace the typed entry with a value from the history. This behavior should be changed to allow the full range of find and replace operations to be performed, while still respecting the case of what the user types. Until this change is made, the feature should be removed. To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 1. Open a document so that Edit->Find/Replace... becomes available. 2. Try typing in the Find field. The behavior is similar for the Replace With field.", 
"EB": "When performing find and replace operations, the typed entry should not be replaced with a value from the history. The behavior should allow the full range of find and replace operations to be performed, while still respecting the case of what the user types. To reproduce the issue, follow these steps: 1. Open a document so that Edit->Find/Replace... becomes available. 2. Try typing in the Find field. The behavior is similar for the Replace With field.", 
"SR": "To reproduce the issue: 1. Choose Edit->Find/Replace... 2. Type 'a' into the Find field. 3. Click 'Find'. 4. Try to type 'A' into the Find field."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '17993', 'title': "Bug 17993Find/Replace shouldn't replace typed entry with value from history", 'description': 'It wouldbe better if what I type isn\'t replaced with a value from the history.The current behaviour seems to be similar to "autocomplete" which isparticularly common in browsers. In the future, perhaps, a full "autocomplete"feature could be provided. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': "Bug 17993Find/Replace shouldn't replace typed entry with value from history For me, it isvery common to perform operations like this.I think the current behaviour to be changed to something more simple whichallows the full range of find and replace operations to be performed. But this should still respect the case of what theuser types. Until then, I think the feature should be removed.To reproduce: Open a document so that EditFind/Replace... becomes available. You shouldn't be able to.The behaviour is similar for the Replace With field. ", 'SR': 'When you type in the "Find" or "Replace With" fields itsearches for entries from a previous search. For example, searching for "hello" and replacing it with "hi" thensearching for "Hello" and replacing it with "Hi" is not possible. Choose EditFind/Replace... Type "a" into the Find field. Click "Find". Try to type "A" into the Find field. '}
